comment: This is generated by ESQL's AbstractFunctionTestCase. Do no edit it. See ../README.md for how to regenerate it.
name: mv_slice
description:
Returns a subset of the multivalued field using the start and end index values.
This is most useful when reading from a function that emits multivalued columns
in a known order like <<esql-split>> or <<esql-mv_sort>>.

params.name: field
params.description: Multivalue expression. If `null`, the function returns `null`.

params.name: start
params.description: Start position. If `null`, the function returns `null`. The start argument can be negative. An index of -1 is used to specify the last value in the list.

params.name: end
params.description: End position(included). Optional; if omitted, the position at `start` is returned. The end argument can be negative. An index of -1 is used to specify the last value in the list.

examples:
row a = [1, 2, 2, 3]
| eval a1 = mv_slice(a, 1), a2 = mv_slice(a, 2, 3)

row a = [1, 2, 2, 3]
| eval a1 = mv_slice(a, -2), a2 = mv_slice(a, -3, -1)
